SMITH, : State Tax Commissioner TAX COMMISSION SRS OF NEBRASKA The position of State Tax. Commissioner was created by the Con - stitution of 1920. Prior thereto the work was performed by a secre - tary to the State Board of Equaliz Uion and Assessment, the Tax Com - missioner being made a member oi the board. Those who have served as Commissioner under the consti utional provision are: NAME COUNTY SERVED W. H. OSBORNE Custer..... April 25. 1921 to April IS, 1923 WM. H. SMITH Seward '. ...April IS, 1923 to Jan. 12. 1925 T. E. WILLIAMS Hamilton. Jan. 12, 1925 to Jan. 8, 1929 HARRY AY. SCOTT Lancaster Jan. S, 1929 to Dec. 1, 1930 WM. H. SMITH...'. Reward.: ...Jan. S. 1931 to

L.ETTER OF TRAXSMITTAI, December 1, 1930. Hon. Arthur J. "Weaver, Governor of Nebraska, Lincoln. My dear Sir: Herewith is transmitted the annual report of this department for the year 1930. In doing so I want to express the appreciation of the department for the co-operation of yourself and the other members of the State Board of Equalization and Assessment. I also want to express my thanks to the County Assessors and County Clerks of the state for their help, and to the other county officers upon whom it has been necessary to make frequent calls for co-operation. Yours very truly, HARRY W. SCOTT, State Tax Commissioner.
York Blank Book Co., York, Nebraska

REPORT OP TAX COMMISSIONER i STATEMENT NO. 2 Intangible Property All property of this kind is divided into two classes, "A" and "B". Class "A" is made up of all kinds of money and is taxable at the rate of 7}/i mills on the dollar. Class "B" is made up of all other kinds of intangible property and is taxable at the rate of eight mills on the dollar. The assessment of stock in banks, Ioanj companies, trust and investment companies is included in Class "B" in accordance with House Roll 421, Session Laws of 1930. The total amount of Class "A" returned for taxation for the year is I $112,090,230, and the total amount of Class "B" is $130,025,601. These figures are taken from the reports as originally returned by the assessors in June. The total amount of taxes that will be paid for intangibles for the year 1930, based on the returns of the assessors is $1,320,430.38 which will be distributed as follows: State General Fund - $220,071.73 County General Fund - 220,071.73 Local City General Fund ...... — 440,143.46 Local School General Fund _ . :.. 440,143.46 The different items of intangibles assessed in 'each county are as follows: ~ — — CLASS "A" CLASS "B" COUNTIES • i i 2 Shares in ' Shares in Valuation Foreign Corp. Deductions At the hearing before this board on May 5, 19iS0, the company sub - mitted Exhibit 43 which showed the market value of investments and railroad stocks owned by this company, together with the assessed ' value of non-carrier properties which are separately taxed. The Ex - hibit also contains the request for the deduction of $60,186,000 listed as treasury assets in railroad property and explained by C. F. Balch in testimony given before the board to be the proceeds of the bond issue for the retirement of $15,000,000 of the Chicago and North - western Railway 10 year gold notes maturing June 1, 1930, and $45, - 186,000 for the purpose of advancing to the Chicago, Saint Paul, Minneapolis and Omaha Railway Company, funds for the retirement of funded debt, maturing in 1930: It was also explained by Balch that this amount was being held in the treasury until the time of maturity of the above described funded debt, and that the same was not on April 1st invested in any railroad property. The board finds that this amount, $60,186,000 not being invested in railroad property, is a proper deduction. It also finds that the market value of the stock owned by this company in the Chicago, Saint Paul, Min - neapolis and Omaha Railroad Company and the Union Pacific Railroad Company should be deducted at its market value, and that the book value of the other investments should be deducted rather than the assessed value submitted in Exhibit 43. STATE OF NEBRASKA STATEMENT NO. 4 Rolling Stock Assessment The rolling stock assessment of the various railroads is made by the State Board of Equalization and assessment in accordance with Section 5874, Compiled Statutes of Nebraska, for 1922. The amount so found is divided by the total number of miles, giving the total valuation per mile, and this amount is multiplied by the number of miles. in each city or. village. This amount is then certified to the county clerk to be added to the assessment, of terminal property which is made by the local assessor and equalized by the State Board. STATE OF NEBRASKA STATEMENT NO. 5 Franchise Assessment The law requires every utility company doing business in Nebraska to report to the State Board of Equalization and Assessment, certain information pertaining to its franchise value. For the year 1930 the Board made - a very thorough and exhaustive study of franchise values. Numerous hearings were held at which the utility companies of the state were given an opportunity to present their views on this matter. ■ REPORT OF TAX COMMISSIONER STATEMENT NO. 7 i State Levy For 1030 RESOLUTION WHEREAS, from the Auditor's report it appears that there was appropriated to be paid out of the general fund the sum of $15,053, - 785.80, one-half of which should be met for the current year, which is $7,526,892.90, and WHEREAS, the Supreme Court of Nebraska has decided that the sum of $470,500 should be provided for in addition to the above, and WHEREAS, the Supreme Court of Nebraska has decided the sum of $260,111.34 appropriated for Reimbursement of depositors in failed banks and which sum was levied by this Board in 1929 is not a valid appropriation making a net increase of $210,388.64 to be levied in addition making the total amount to be raised for the current year $ 7,737,281.54 To meet which it is estimated there will be available miscellaneous col - lections for the general fund not other - wise appropriated $ 1,142,339.92 , General Fund collections to 1 be de - rived from intangible taxes : 219,823.71 1,362,163.63 $ 6,375,117.93 Which amount is increased 3% in accordance with House Roll 189 Session Laws of 1927 191,253.53 Leaving to be raised from the 1930 General Fund Levy ? 6,566,371.46 The assessed value of the tangible property of the state as of record in the office of the State Tax Com - missioner is .....$3,102,050,571 A levy of 2.12 will raise '. $ C, 576, 346. 00 The Capitol Fund Levy as fixed by law is .22 of one mill and on the assessed valuation of the State will raise 682,452.00 THEREFORE, BE IT RESOLVED, that the levies for 1930 be as follows: GENERAL FUND 2.12 Mills $ 6,576,346.00 CAPITOL FUND '. 22 Mills 682,452.00 TOTAL 2.34 Mills $ 7,258,798.00 i
